DOC.brief_summary: Excessive infant cry ( EIC ) likely increase risk child abuse . The investigator propose randomize trial use intervention base recommendation Karp . The investigator systematically identify 170 term infant EIC conduct assessment home 6-8 week age test hypothesis intervention reduces mean infant hour night-time cry , increase maternal soothe behavior improve parental anxiety depression .
DOC.detailed_description: Hypotheses : The soothe technique teach study parent 2-3 wks birth augment parental soothing skill reduce infant cry night ( primary outcome ) parental sleep loss , distress , & depression assess home mask nurse 8 wks . Methods : Term singleton infant EIC ( > 3 hrs/24h ) recruit program offer parent hospital ( 4,700 births/yr ) see clinic 2-3 wks birth . Consenting family ( n=178 ) randomize standard colic counseling ( American Academy Pediatrics ) intervention ( add nurse instruction plus video pamphlet ) . At 8 wks study nurse ass parental sleep distress ( Brief Symptom Inventory-18 ) , place dosimeter room infant sleep spends time , apply actigraph ankle . She collect device 5 day later , perform physical exam usual feeding time ( EIC likely ) , record infant & maternal behavior crying/feeding next 15 minute use unobtrusive , validated method ( Tyson , 1992 ) , provide maternal support desire . Standard statistical test use ( alpha=0.05 ; beta = 0.20 ; effect size =0.5 SD , power = .90 ) .
DOC.criteria: term , singleton neonate otherwise healthy parent must least 6th grade understand English Spanish infant must colic ( great 3 hour cry per day ) OR infant 's cry cause excessive stress either parent condition would reasonably impact alertness behavior
